CONVERSATION GROUP: BK I said I had ONE pass, and it doesn't come cheap. Why should I give it to you if it means I can't get in?
You'll be happy to know I was able to get my cart inside as well. So feel free to check out my wares, I'll even give you my special errand boy discount!
BK It seemed like a good business opportunity. All those unfortunate souls stuck outside the gates were surely in need of supplies. And it'd kill me inside if I didn't offer my support.
You can see for yourself.  I'll even give you a discount for being such helpful customers.
BK Not sure if the LIE really makes sense here? Is there a conditional that should be on this?

BK not sure why there are no conditions on here?
BK - I shortened this chain substantially and remoeved the NPC responses.
BK We met someone in the sewers that had been watching us.
So the Dead Rats caught wind of it before the job was done....
I guess I should have entrusted the job to someone who could have handled it more subtly. Did you at least finish dropping off the packages?
Yes.  We dropped off all of the packages.
BK Then our business is complete. You've proven to be quite the little helpers. I'll keep you in mind next time I need a job done.
[SUCCESS] I suppose that's fair. After all, I didn't imply the dangers you might be facing.  I wouldn't want to lose such loyal customers.
Here, a little bit extra for your trouble.  And feel free to browse my wares.  Now that I've gotten my cart inside I can finally set up shop.
Why don't I add a little bonus to your reward?  For your troubles?
Good. That's more than I'd usually pay for a job, but you are valued customers after all.
You've got a lot to learn if you're going to do business in Luskan. Here. It's not the full amount but I suppose you deserve something for getting some of the job done.

BK Well you see, it just so happens that I've found word a very powerful artifact that lies in dangerous hands. I have a client desperate to see the item returned to a more responsible party, like myself.
BK removed the nothin' -- that's a speech artifact for characters with personality. Don't think it is applicable to the player.
BK The pirate known as One-Legged Larry recently came across a new peg leg he found while raiding overseas. This Leg isn't actually a leg at all... but a powerful weapon, if held by the right hands.
Excellent. You should find Larry hanging out near the Cutlass. He's always looking for more coin for another drink.
Oh, and don't mention any of this to Larry. We don't want him to realize the power he holds. Just get it away from him... any means necessary.
BK Well now, if it isn't my favorite set of go-getters! I've got just the job for you fine folks!
Burkins, I'm beginning to hate you.
BK Oh, don't be so dramatic! It'll all be fine. This will certainly open you up to more jobs in the future, so think of it as an investment!
I don't think I want to work for you again.
BK Good point. I expect to see a hefty return on this.
BK No problem! You'll be first on my list when another high paying job pops up!
BK I added this because otherwise the inner hub would have only given the player the option to say they dislike Burkins. Which they might not.

BK original line "What are the Ships?"
BK how do we know if the player does or does not know about the Ships?
BK Oh, they just control most of Luskan with an iron fist. Larry was a member of one of 'em... can't recall which. Nothing you need to worry about, for sure.
BK BURKINS: Well then, don't let me keep you. Hop to it!
BK Now, maybe when you've cooled your heads a bit, come talk to me and maybe I can set you up with a good deal.
BK I've got plenty of stock from outside the gates, more than enough to replace what was lost in that raid.
BK Well hop to it!  I don't have all day, you know.
[FAILURE] I don't think so. This is a dangerous business, and you should get used to having your hands dirtied if you want to keep working for me.
You'll get the agreed upon amount and nothing more.  Now, you've proven to be quite the little helpers.  I'll keep you in mind next time I need a job done.
I've been harassed by the best in the business kid, you're not gonna scare me.
BK cut the following line because it seemed extraneous and prone to become "out of date"... "With any luck, we'll all be in Luskan in two or three days."

BK Argh, my mouth is parched and I haven't a coin to my name to remedy the problem.
(this line used to set C2_BC_Refresh, but the flag doesn't exist anymore, so I am removing it - Patrick)
BK Actually, we were hoping you could give us your peg leg.
What?! How would I get around? No, I don't think so.
BK So... you wouldn't sell it for this 3000 gold I have right here...?
Er... well... um... okay, fine. I would sell it for 3000 gold. You gonna buy it?
BK Well now! That's a hard bargain you drive, but here you go!
Well, I did try to do this peacefully.... <Kill.>
Eh, don't worry so much. Here's another. <Give beer.>

Changed this since we can't easily make him fall over from his sitting position.
OLD: [The man collapses]

Changing this line because I added the ability to give him a drink below this, and it would sound repetitive.
OLD: Mighty kind of you! But if you think you're getting this leg from me, you're gonna need a whole lot more than one!

Changing this so it doesn't imply he'll give us a better deal after drinks (he needs to be drunk) and indicating where to get it.
OLD: My poison's a little brew called Waterdhavian Fire Ale.  Why don't you pick some up and we can talk after I've had a few?
